info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 12:23AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Mecklenburg, south central Gaston and north central York Counties through 100 AM EDT... At 1222 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near York, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... York, Clover, Newport, Steele Creek, Lake Wylie, Crowders Mountain State Park, South Gastonia, Crowders and Bethany. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
